fields.description: Euclid is a math contest that is also hosted by the University of Waterloo. It gives senior-level secondary-school students the opportunity to solve novel problems with creative thinking and all the knowledge gained throughout secondary-school mathematics. Although the difficulty of the contest is targeted towards seniors in high school, all grades are welcome to write it. The contest is made up of 10 short-answer and full-solution questions. The duration of it is 2.5 hours and will be scored out of a total of 100. The contest will be $15 and will be written on Tuesday, April 4th, 2023.
Come join Mackenzie's concert band in their annual performance! We can't wait to show you what we have in store!

Need a brrrreak from the winter weather? ü•∂ That's snow problem. ‚ùÑÔ∏è Why not settle down with a nice cup of hot cocoa and focus on a nice winter-themed LCC instead? 

The third Lyon's Computing Competition (LCC) of the year will be coming up this Thursday (December 22) at 5pm to 7:30pm! In case you forgot, it is a team programming competition with both a junior and a senior division for Mackenzie students.

CCC registration is now open! ü•≥ The contest will be taking place February 16, 2023 and you will be able to participate in either the junior or senior division through WLMAC.

Note that you must have met both the lesson and the LCC requirements by the contest date to participate.

Contest costs $10 dollars.
